Hi there! I am working on an email template project where I have a request to dynamically populate "rate" information based on the customer's region. The ask was to host rate information in a central location and have the email template populate it dynamically based on what region the person was in.

In HubSpot, can I identify the person's region based on where he opens the email? Would that be a good approach? Please let me know your thoughts! Thanks, Sri

You’re better off collecting that somehow as your own data directly from the user. Trying to guess someone’s location based on where they open the email is not accurate due to proxy servers ISPs use. Additionally someone could open an email away from home (i.e. vacation) or while using a VPN which may then not provide accurate info.
